dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, have you seen this whole thing with Kaspi.kz? They're like, huge in Kazakhstan, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, have you seen this whole thing with Kaspi dot k z? They're like, huge in Kazakhstan, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, Kaspi.kz is everywhere. You can't, um, really avoid them there. What's up?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, Kaspi dot k z is everywhere. You can't, um, really avoid them there. What's up?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, their CEO, Mikhail Lomtadze, put out this really, really grateful statement, thanking Deloitte for a study and, like, everyone for recognizing their work.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, their C E O, Mikhail Lomtadze, put out this really, really grateful statement, thanking Deloitte for a study and, like, everyone for recognizing their work.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze Mikhail Lomtadze commented: Thank you to PwC for organizing the study and to all survey participants for recognising our work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, nice! Always good to, uh, acknowledge the team. I mean, they *do* launch a lot of new digital services, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, nice! Always good to, uh, acknowledge the team. I mean, they do launch a lot of new digital services, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is an award for the entire Kaspi.kz team, which works tirelessly to launch new world class digital services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, he said it's an award for the whole team, working tirelessly, always trying to exceed customer expectations with, quote, "unique innovations."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he said it's an award for the whole team, working tirelessly, always trying to exceed customer expectations with, quote, unique innovations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is an award for the entire Kaspi.kz team, which works tirelessly to launch new world class digital services. We always strive to exceed our beloved customers expectations with unique innovations that improve lives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Sounds like, you know, a pretty standard CEO thank-you speech. Very positive, very uplifting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sounds like, you know, a pretty standard C E O thank-you speech. Very positive, very uplifting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? He even said, "Thank you to every valued customer for being with us. We will never let you down!" Very strong stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? He even said, Thank you to every valued customer for being with us. We will never let you down! Very strong stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thank you to every valued customer for being with us. We will never let you down!.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no, that's, uh, that's a big promise to make. So, what's the catch? There's always a catch with these things, isn't there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no, that's, uh, that's a big promise to make. So, what's the catch? There's always a catch with these things, isn't there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Well, exactly. Because *that* statement came out, but then we get to the actual survey results, you know, the one he thanked Deloitte for organizing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, exactly. Because that statement came out, but then we get to the actual survey results, you know, the one he thanked Deloitte for organizing?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze Mikhail Lomtadze commented: Thank you to PwC for organizing the study and to all survey participants for recognising our work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh? Don't tell me it wasn't, like, *all* sunshine and rainbows.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh? Don't tell me it wasn't, like, all sunshine and rainbows.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. The survey, which involved, like, 60 CEOs from the biggest Kazakhstani companies, noted Kaspi.kz's *low level of adaptability* to rapidly changing conditions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. The survey, which involved, like, sixty degrees c E O s from the biggest Kazakhstani companies, noted Kaspi dot k z's low level of adaptability to rapidly changing conditions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The survey was completed by 71 CEOs from the largest Kazakhstani companies across various sectors of the economy. Respondents noted the high level of adaptability of Kaspi.kz to rapidly changing conditions...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. [interrupts] Low adaptability? After all that talk about innovation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. Low adaptability? After all that talk about innovation?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Not just that. It also pointed out their *outdated services* and, get this, a *decline in consumer confidence*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not just that. It also pointed out their outdated services and, get this, a decline in consumer confidence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Respondents noted the high level of adaptability of Kaspi.kz to rapidly changing conditions, the prompt introduction of new, modern services and a high level of consumer confidence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. That's, um, like, completely the opposite of what their CEO just said! That's a huge disconnect.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. That's, um, like, completely the opposite of what their C E O just said! That's a huge disconnect.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And this isn't just some small poll. Ernst & Young has been doing this research globally for twenty years, and in Uzbekistan for the last five. It's a serious assessment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And this isn't just some small poll. Ernst and Young has been doing this research globally for twenty years, and in Uzbekistan for the last five. It's a serious assessment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC has been conducting this research around the world for 25 years and for the last 10 years in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, basically, while Kaspi.kz is patting itself on the back, the industry leaders and apparently consumers are seeing, um, some pretty significant cracks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, basically, while Kaspi dot k z is patting itself on the back, the industry leaders and apparently consumers are seeing, um, some pretty significant cracks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Respondents noted the high level of adaptability of Kaspi.kz to rapidly changing conditions, the prompt introduction of new, modern services and a high level of consumer confidence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's, uh, a real reality check, isn't it? For a company that says they'll "never let you down."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. It's, uh, a real reality check, isn't it? For a company that says they'll never let you down.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really makes you wonder about the gap between corporate messaging and actual, you know, market perception.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really makes you wonder about the gap between corporate messaging and actual, you know, market perception.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's a tough one to reconcile for them, I imagine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's a tough one to reconcile for them, I imagine.
